page.title: 03DUMYAT- MENSTRIE'S "VOLCANO"
page.content: Dumyat is 418 metres high and is an extinct volcano. Dumyat is the best known hill of the range called the {Ochil Hills.}The name Dumyat is {Pictish}and means "Hill of the Picts". Many remains of pictish settlements have been found on Dumyat. Also it is said that covens of{witches}used Dumyat as a meeting place. To celebrate the{Queen's Silver {Jubilee}in 1977 a beacon was lit on Dumyat. Every year on the 1st of May,{May Day, it is traditional to climb Dumyat and wash your face in the dew. A{local author,}Rennie McOwan, featured Dumyat and the surroundings in his children's novel "Light on Dumyat".
